comment.text: In addition to its role as a glycolytic enzyme, it seems that PGK-1 acts as a polymerase alpha cofactor protein (primer recognition protein) (PubMed:2324090). May play a role in sperm motility (PubMed:26677959).
Carbohydrate degradation; glycolysis; pyruvate from D-glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate: step 2/5.
Mainly expressed in spermatogonia. Localized on the principle piece in the sperm (at protein level). Expression significantly decreased in the testis of elderly men.

disease.name: Phosphoglycerate kinase 1 deficiency
disease.description: A condition with a highly variable clinical phenotype that includes hemolytic anemia, rhabdomyolysis, myopathy and neurologic involvement. Patients can express one or more of these manifestations.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the phosphoglycerate kinase family.

comment.name: SHMPD
comment.text: The Singapore human mutation and polymorphism database
